question: Which three countries share the location of "Trifinio Biosphere Reserve"?
explanation: The Trifinio Biosphere Reserve is a tri-national biosphere reserve located between El Salvador, Guatemala and Honduras. It is the first transboundary biosphere reserve in Central America and represents a major contribution to the implementation of the Mesoamerican Corridor. It includes key biodiversity areas, such as Montecristo National Park and a variety of forest ecosystems. A key function of this mountain area is guaranteeing water supply for local communities. It also plays an important role in regional development through the promotion of coffee activities, conifer forest extraction and agro-tourism. This biosphere reserve has received strong support at high political levels, as well as the involvement of local communities in promoting sustainable development.
